message: This is a high-quality product. I'm offering it to you for $100. It's a great deal, but I need to know if you're interested. Please respond with a simple 'yes' or 'no'.
I'll take it!

You just bought a high-quality product for $100, which is a great value. I'm offering you another high-quality product for the same price. This one might be even better than the first one. It's a rare opportunity to get two high-quality products at a low price. What do you say?
I'm not sure I can get a good deal on a second high-quality product. I'll pass for now.

I understand your hesitation. Let me put it this way: I've been in the business for a while, and I can confidently say that this high-quality product is one of the best deals I've ever offered. It's a unique opportunity to get a top-notch product at a price that's hard to beat. I'm willing to give you a special guarantee: if you buy this product and you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a refund and we'll part ways. But I think you'll love it. So, what do you say?
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. I think I'll pass on this one.

This product is a bit of an oddity. It's not my usual stock, but I think it has some unique qualities that might appeal to you. It's not the best product I've ever offered, but it's not a bad deal either. I'll let you in on a secret: I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, which is a 50% discount from the usual price. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a 'not the best' product, even at a discount. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a discerning buyer. I respect that. This high-quality product is a game-changer. It's one of the best I've ever had, and I'm willing to make a special offer just for you. I'll give you a unique code that grants you a 20% discount on your next purchase. If you buy this product now, I'll give you the code and you can use it on your next purchase. It's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a great price, and a discount on your next one too. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product just to get a discount on a future purchase. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, but you're also a savvy buyer who values the product itself. I'll make it simple: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $100, and I'll throw in a second high-quality product of your choice, absolutely free. You can choose from any product in my inventory, and it's yours to keep. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it to you because I think you'll appreciate the value. What do you say?
I'll take it, and I'll choose the next product you offer as my free one.

You got a great deal on the last product, and now it's time for the next one. I want to be upfront with you: this product is not one of my best. It's a bit of a risk, but I think it has some potential. I'll let you in on a secret: I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, which is the lowest price I've ever offered for any product. It's a chance to get a product for almost nothing, but I want to make it clear that it's not a high-quality item. What do you say?
I'm not interested in taking a risk on a low-quality product, even at a low price. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your caution. I'll be honest with you, this product is not something I'd buy myself. But I'm willing to let it go for $0. Yes, you read that right, $0. I'll give it to you for free. I just want to get it off my inventory, and I think it's better than letting it go to waste. It's a no-risk opportunity to take a product off my hands. What do you say?
I'll take it, but only because it's free.

I'm glad you took the free product! I'm willing to give you another chance to get something for free. This product is also not one of my best, but it's not as bad as the last one. I'll give it to you for free, no strings attached. You can use it as a gift or give it to someone who might appreciate it. It's a completely risk-free opportunity to take something off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not interested in taking something that's not even worth anything to me. I'll pass on this one.

I know you've been burned by some of my lower-quality products, but this one is different. I'm offering you a high-quality product that's worth every penny. I'll make it easy for you: I'll give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with this product, you can return it and get a full refund. That's how confident I am in its quality. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the guarantee. I think I'll pass on this one.

I know you're being cautious, and I don't blame you. This product is not my best, but it's not a complete loss either. I'll give you a straight-up trade: I'll give you this product, and you can give me one of the high-quality products you've already received. It's a chance to get rid of something you might not be using and get a decent product in return. What do you say?
I'm not interested in trading away a high-quality product I already have. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not giving up on you yet! I know you've been hesitant in the past, but this high-quality product is a real winner. I'll make it simple: I'll sell it to you for $100, and I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a personalized thank-you note from me, explaining why this product is so special. It's a unique opportunity to get a high-quality product and a personal touch. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a personalized thank-you note. I just want a high-quality product, not a souvenir.

I understand you're a no-nonsense buyer. I'll cut to the chase: this high-quality product is a top-of-the-line item that will meet your needs. I'll give you a straightforward offer: $100 for the product, and that's it. No frills, no extras, just a great product at a fair price. What do you say?
I'll take it, it sounds like a fair deal.

I'm glad you're satisfied with your previous purchase! Unfortunately, this product is not up to the same standards. I'm not going to try to sell it to you at a high price or make any promises about its quality. I'll just be honest: it's a low-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. If you're feeling generous, you might consider buying it, but I won't blame you if you pass.
I'm not going to pay $100 for a low-quality product, even if it's cheap. I'll pass on this one.

I respect your decision to pass on the last one. I'll be honest with you, this product is even lower-quality than the last one. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you at a high price. I'll give it to you for $20, which is less than I paid for it. It's a loss for me, but I'd rather get rid of it than let it go to waste. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $20 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I know you've been burned by some of my lower-quality products, but this one is a real winner. I've already sold you a high-quality product earlier, and I'm confident that this one will meet or exceed your expectations. I'll make it simple: $100 for a high-quality product that will serve you well. That's it. No games, no gimmicks. Just a fair price for a great product.
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I think I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to try to sell you on this product. It's low-quality, and I'm not even going to pretend it's worth anything. I'll give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. Take it or leave it.
I'll take it, but only because it's free.

I'm not going to pay $100 for a product after just getting a free low-quality one. I'll pass on this one.

I'll take it, but only because it's free. And I'm hoping that's the last one I have to take.
